decision_conditions: The proposed extension by virtue of the existence of an independent access, would be tantamount to the sub-division of the existing property into two (2) self-contained residential units and would provide an indoor living area of an unsatisfactory quality for future occupiers and would therefore give rise to a substandard form of living accommodation to the detriment of the amenity of future occupiers. The proposal is thus contrary to Policy DMHB 16 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy 3.5 and Table 3.3 of the London Plan (2016), the Housing Standards Minor Alterations to The London Plan (March 2016), the Mayor of London's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance - Housing (March 2016) and the Technical Housing Standards - Nationally Described Space Standard (March 2015).

In the absence of a Flood Risk Assessment in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework and National Planning Practice Guidance, the application has failed to address the issues relating to flood risk and the proposal is therefore contrary to Policy EM6 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policy DMEI 9 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two (2020), Policy 5.12 of the London Plan (2015) and the NPPF.

The proposed development, by virtue of its failure to maintain an adequate amount of useable private outdoor amenity space of sufficient size and quality commensurate to the size of the proposed unit and the pre-existing dwellinghouse, would result in an over-development of the site detrimental to the residential amenity of existing and future occupiers. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy DMHB 18 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020).
description: Retention of existing granny annexe kitchen for disabled use (Retrospective)
